entry.title: The Part That Survives
entry.summary:
Author: Joy_peace

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,159Chapters: 5/6Kudos: 11

Summary: Years after the events of Season 6B, Beacon Hills has grown quieter. The monsters sleep, the pack has built lives, and Liam Dunbar has learned how to breathe again after losing the person he loved most. But grief is strange in Beacon Hills. It doesn‚Äôt fade. It rearranges itself into something sharp, something hungry, something that whispers: What if? Five months after Theo Raeken‚Äôs death, strange storms begin forming in the woods. Lights flicker. Trees crack with electricity. Liam dreams of Theo like he‚Äôs standing right beside him‚Äîuntil the line between dream and reality blurs violently. Because Theo isn‚Äôt dead.Not really.Not anymore. Something dragged him back wrong‚Äîhalf energy, half ghost, half chimera, flickering and unstable‚Äîand every time he gets close to Liam, the static under his skin grows worse. The pack rallies. Old bonds strengthen. New ones form. And Liam faces the terrifying truth: loving someone who‚Äôs come back from the dead means learning how to hold them together without losing yourself. But Theo didn‚Äôt come back for revenge. Or redemption. He came back for Liam.

entry.title: You‚Äôre Safe, I‚Äôm Here
entry.summary:
Author: Joy_peace

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,938Chapters: 15/22Kudos: 23

Summary: The Beacon Hills Preserve had always been quiet in the early evenings, the kind of quiet that hummed in the bones of anyone supernatural. Most people would call it peaceful. Liam Dunbar called it suspicious. He walked a few steps ahead, his eyes flicking between the trees, inhaling like he expected to catch a threat in the damp leaves or the wind. His shoulders were coiled tight‚Äîtoo tight for a patrol that was supposed to be routine. The sun hovered low enough to stain the whole forest with orange and copper. Behind him, Theo Raeken let out a slow, theatrical sigh. ‚ÄúDunbar,‚Äù he said, voice low but full of a patience he very smugly claimed he didn‚Äôt have, ‚Äúyou‚Äôre clenching your jaw so hard I can hear your molars trying to fuse.‚Äù

entry.title: A Little Bit Older
entry.summary:
Author: EverythingRara

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,408Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 61

Summary: It was a short twenty-minute ride, and then Stiles was stepping out onto the driveway of his childhood home. ‚ÄúYou got a new roof,‚Äù Stiles said, eyebrows rising as he took in the fresh shingles. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù his father grunted, wrenching Stiles‚Äô luggage out of the trunk. ‚ÄúTree landed on the house last year. I thought I told you?‚Äù Stiles hurried over, reaching for his bags‚Äîonly for his hand to get smacked away. ‚ÄúI got it,‚Äù his father said firmly, like the idea of Stiles carrying his own luggage was some kind of insult. Stiles rolled his eyes and shoved his hands into his pockets. ‚ÄúYeah, I think I remember now. Scott helped you fix it, didn‚Äôt he?‚Äù Noah‚Äôs face brightened. ‚ÄúHe did. Boy‚Äôs really made a good company for himself. Had to fight him to let me pay.‚Äù Stiles‚Äô smile slipped, memories settling heavy in his stomach. They walked up the driveway. Stiles‚Äô gaze drifted toward the garage, a thought sparking. ‚ÄúHey, Dad,‚Äù he said, scanning the driveway. ‚ÄúWhere‚Äôs my baby Roscoe?‚Äù Noah‚Äôs expression pinched. Uncomfortable. Guilty. ‚ÄúAbout that‚Ä¶"
